advantages.name: 2 - Choose a total of 30 Points in Advantages from the following list:

features.situation: from sapient being with whom you actively interact (converse, lecture, etc.)
on all IQ rolls to wake up or to recover from surprise or mental stun
to initiative rolls for your side (+2 if you are the leader)

children.name: Fit

features.situation: to all HT rolls to stay conscious, avoid death, resist disease, or resist poison

children.notes: Recover FP at twice the normal rate (but not FP spent for spells or psi powers)

features.situation: to your effective HT whenever you roll to recover lost HP or to see if you can get over a crippling injury

advantages.name: 4 -Choose a total of -30 points in Disadvantages from the following list:

children.name: Claustrophobia (Enclosed Spaces)
children.notes: You are uncomfortable any time you can’t see the sky – or at least a very high ceiling. In a small room or vehicle, you feel the walls closing in on you... You need air! This is a dangerous fear for someone who plans to go underground.

children.name: Impulsiveness
children.notes: Make a self-control roll whenever it would be wise to wait and ponder. If you fail, you must act

children.name: Overconfidence

features.situation: from young or naive individuals who believe you are as good as you say you are

children.notes: You must make a self-control roll any time the GM feels you show an unreasonable degree of caution. If you fail, you must go ahead as though you were able to handle the situation!

children.name: Choose one Skill from the following list:

notes.text: 1,000 points - A high-end analog of the Shaper, you have power not just over some measure of an element but over natural phenomena on a wide scale. You can attack your foes with the force of a natural disaster. This template is designed around controlling  the weather, but power over other natural phenomena such as the oceans or seismic events could be treated similarly.
